___name.description: The name of the application resource.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
The application resource properties.

___minimumNodes.description: The minimum number of nodes where Service Fabric will reserve capacity for this application. Note that this does not mean that the services of this application will be placed on all of those nodes. If this property is set to zero, no capacity will be reserved. The value of this property cannot be more than the value of the MaximumNodes property.

___removeApplicationCapacity.description: Remove the current application capacity settings.

___typeName.description: The application type name as defined in the application manifest.

___upgradePolicy.description: Describes the policy for a monitored application upgrade.

___parameters.description: List of application parameters with overridden values from their default values specified in the application manifest.

___typeVersion.description: The version of the application type as defined in the application manifest.

___metrics.description: List of application capacity metric description.

___maximumNodes.description: The maximum number of nodes where Service Fabric will reserve capacity for this application. Note that this does not mean that the services of this application will be placed on all of those nodes. By default, the value of this property is zero and it means that the services can be placed on any node.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
Microsoft.ServiceFabric/clusters/applications/services

___name.description: The name of the service resource in the format of {applicationName}~{serviceName}.
The name of the service resource in the format of {applicationName}~{serviceName}.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
The service resource properties.

___partitionDescription.description: Describes how the service is partitioned.

___servicePackageActivationMode.description: The activation Mode of the service package.

___defaultMoveCost.description: Specifies the move cost for the service.

___correlationScheme.description: A list that describes the correlation of the service with other services.

___servicePlacementPolicies.description: A list that describes the correlation of the service with other services.

___serviceLoadMetrics.description: The service load metrics is given as an array of ServiceLoadMetricDescription objects.

___placementConstraints.description: The placement constraints as a string. Placement constraints are boolean expressions on node properties and allow for restricting a service to particular nodes based on the service requirements. For example, to place a service on nodes where NodeType is blue specify the following: "NodeColor == blue)".

___serviceTypeName.description: The name of the service type

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___name.description: The name of the cluster resource.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
Describes the cluster resource properties.

___fabricSettings.description: The list of custom fabric settings to configure the cluster.

___certificateCommonNames.description: Describes a list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

___upgradeDescription.description: Describes the policy used when upgrading the cluster.

___managementEndpoint.description: The http management endpoint of the cluster.

___upgradeMode.description:
The upgrade mode of the cluster when new Service Fabric runtime version is available.

  - Automatic - The cluster will be automatically upgraded to the latest Service Fabric runtime version as soon as it is available.
  - Manual - The cluster will not be automatically upgraded to the latest Service Fabric runtime version. The cluster is upgraded by setting the **clusterCodeVersion** property in the cluster resource.
.

___clientCertificateThumbprints.description: The list of client certificates referenced by thumbprint that are allowed to manage the cluster.

___vmImage.description: The VM image VMSS has been configured with. Generic names such as Windows or Linux can be used.

___clusterCodeVersion.description: The Service Fabric runtime version of the cluster. This property can only by set the user when **upgradeMode** is set to 'Manual'. To get list of available Service Fabric versions for new clusters use [ClusterVersion API](./ClusterVersion.md). To get the list of available version for existing clusters use **availableClusterVersions**.

___addOnFeatures.description: The list of add-on features to enable in the cluster.

___azureActiveDirectory.description: The settings to enable AAD authentication on the cluster.

___nodeTypes.description: The list of node types in the cluster.

___clientCertificateCommonNames.description: The list of client certificates referenced by common name that are allowed to manage the cluster.

___reverseProxyCertificateCommonNames.description: Describes a list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

___reliabilityLevel.description:
The reliability level sets the replica set size of system services. Learn about [ReliabilityLevel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-cluster-capacity).

  - None - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 1. This should only be used for test clusters.
  - Bronze - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 3. This should only be used for test clusters.
  - Silver - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 5.
  - Gold - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 7.
  - Platinum - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 9.
.

___diagnosticsStorageAccountConfig.description: The storage account information for storing Service Fabric diagnostic logs.

___eventStoreServiceEnabled.description: Indicates if the event store service is enabled.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maxPercentDeltaUnhealthyServices.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of services health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the services at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the services at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits.

_88NodeTypeDescription.description: Describes a node type in the cluster, each node type represents sub set of nodes in the cluster.

___name.description: The name of the node type.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___isPrimary.description: The node type on which system services will run. Only one node type should be marked as primary. Primary node type cannot be deleted or changed for existing clusters.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___durabilityLevel.description:
The durability level of the node type. Learn about [DurabilityLevel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-cluster-capacity).

  - Bronze - No privileges. This is the default.
  - Silver - The infrastructure jobs can be paused for a duration of 10 minutes per UD.
  - Gold - The infrastructure jobs can be paused for a duration of 2 hours per UD. Gold durability can be enabled only on full node VM skus like D15_V2, G5 etc.
.

_88ArmRollingUpgradeMonitoringPolicy.description: The policy used for monitoring the application upgrade

___upgradeDomainTimeout.description: The amount of time each upgrade domain has to complete before FailureAction is executed. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___upgradeTimeout.description: The amount of time the overall upgrade has to complete before FailureAction is executed. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___healthCheckStableDuration.description: The amount of time that the application or cluster must remain healthy before the upgrade proceeds to the next upgrade domain. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___healthCheckRetryTimeout.description: The amount of time to retry health evaluation when the application or cluster is unhealthy before FailureAction is executed. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___healthCheckWaitDuration.description: The amount of time to wait after completing an upgrade domain before applying health policies. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___failureAction.description: The activation Mode of the service package.

___name.description: The parameter name of fabric setting.

___value.description: The parameter value of fabric setting.

_88ApplicationDeltaHealthPolicy.description: Defines a delta health policy used to evaluate the health of an application or one of its child entities when upgrading the cluster.

$eref.description: Represents the delta health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type when upgrading the cluster.

___maxPercentDeltaUnhealthyServices.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of services health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the services at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the services at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___defaultServiceTypeDeltaHealthPolicy.description: Represents the delta health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type when upgrading the cluster.

$eref.description: Represents the delta health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type when upgrading the cluster.

___maxPercentDeltaUnhealthyServices.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of services health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the services at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the services at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___serviceTypeDeltaHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a map that contains specific delta health policies for different service types.
Each entry specifies as key the service type name and as value a ServiceTypeDeltaHealthPolicy used to evaluate the service health when upgrading the cluster.
The map is empty by default.

_88ClusterUpgradePolicy.description: Describes the policy used when upgrading the cluster.

___upgradeDomainTimeout.description: The amount of time each upgrade domain has to complete before the upgrade rolls back. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___upgradeTimeout.description: The amount of time the overall upgrade has to complete before the upgrade rolls back. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___forceRestart.description: If true, then processes are forcefully restarted during upgrade even when the code version has not changed (the upgrade only changes configuration or data).

___healthCheckStableDuration.description: The amount of time that the application or cluster must remain healthy before the upgrade proceeds to the next upgrade domain. The duration can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

$eref.description: Describes the delta health policies for the cluster upgrade.

___applicationDeltaHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a map that contains specific application delta health policies for different applications.
Each entry specifies as key the application name and as value an ApplicationDeltaHealthPolicy used to evaluate the application health when upgrading the cluster.
The application name should include the 'fabric:' URI scheme.
The map is empty by default.

___maxPercentDeltaUnhealthyNodes.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of nodes health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the nodes at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the nodes at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits.

___maxPercentDeltaUnhealthyApplications.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of applications health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the applications at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the applications at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits. System services are not included in this.

___maxPercentUpgradeDomainDeltaUnhealthy.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of upgrade domain nodes health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the upgrade domain nodes at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the upgrade domain nodes at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion for all completed upgrade domains to make sure the state of the upgrade domains is within tolerated limits.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___deltaHealthPolicy.description: Describes the delta health policies for the cluster upgrade.

$eref.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of the cluster or of a cluster node.

___maxPercentUnhealthyNodes.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy nodes before reporting an error. For example, to allow 10% of nodes to be unhealthy, this value would be 10.

The percentage represents the maximum tolerated percentage of nodes that can be unhealthy before the cluster is considered in error.
If the percentage is respected but there is at least one unhealthy node, the health is evaluated as Warning.
The percentage is calculated by dividing the number of unhealthy nodes over the total number of nodes in the cluster.
The computation rounds up to tolerate one failure on small numbers of nodes. Default percentage is zero.

In large clusters, some nodes will always be down or out for repairs, so this percentage should be configured to tolerate that.

___maxPercentUnhealthyApplications.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy applications before reporting an error. For example, to allow 10% of applications to be unhealthy, this value would be 10.

The percentage represents the maximum tolerated percentage of applications that can be unhealthy before the cluster is considered in error.
If the percentage is respected but there is at least one unhealthy application, the health is evaluated as Warning.
This is calculated by dividing the number of unhealthy applications over the total number of application instances in the cluster, excluding applications of application types that are included in the ApplicationTypeHealthPolicyMap.
The computation rounds up to tolerate one failure on small numbers of applications. Default percentage is zero.

___applicationHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a map that contains specific application health policies for different applications.
Each entry specifies as key the application name and as value an ApplicationHealthPolicy used to evaluate the application health.
The application name should include the 'fabric:' URI scheme.
The map is empty by default.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___healthPolicy.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of the cluster or of a cluster node.

___healthCheckRetryTimeout.description: The amount of time to retry health evaluation when the application or cluster is unhealthy before the upgrade rolls back. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___upgradeReplicaSetCheckTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to block processing of an upgrade domain and prevent loss of availability when there are unexpected issues. When this timeout expires, processing of the upgrade domain will proceed regardless of availability loss issues. The timeout is reset at the start of each upgrade domain. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___healthCheckWaitDuration.description: The length of time to wait after completing an upgrade domain before performing health checks. The duration can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

$eref.description: Specifies a metric to load balance a service during runtime.

___name.description: The name of the metric. If the service chooses to report load during runtime, the load metric name should match the name that is specified in Name exactly. Note that metric names are case sensitive.

___weight.description: The service load metric relative weight, compared to other metrics configured for this service, as a number.

___defaultLoad.description: Used only for Stateless services. The default amount of load, as a number, that this service creates for this metric.

___primaryDefaultLoad.description: Used only for Stateful services. The default amount of load, as a number, that this service creates for this metric when it is a Primary replica.

___secondaryDefaultLoad.description: Used only for Stateful services. The default amount of load, as a number, that this service creates for this metric when it is a Secondary replica.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

Placement constraints are boolean expressions on node properties and allow for restricting a service to particular nodes based on the service requirements. For example, to place a service on nodes where NodeType is blue specify the following: "NodeColor == blue)".

___maxPercentUnhealthyDeployedApplicatio.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy deployed applications. Allowed values are Byte values from zero to 100.
The percentage represents the maximum tolerated percentage of deployed applications that can be unhealthy before the application is considered in error.
This is calculated by dividing the number of unhealthy deployed applications over the number of nodes where the application is currently deployed on in the cluster.
The computation rounds up to tolerate one failure on small numbers of nodes. Default percentage is zero.

$eref.description: Represents the health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type.

___maxPercentUnhealthyPartitionsPerServi.description: The maximum percentage of partitions per service allowed to be unhealthy before your application is considered in error.

___maxPercentUnhealthyServices.description: The maximum percentage of services allowed to be unhealthy before your application is considered in error.

___maxPercentUnhealthyReplicasPerPartiti.description: The maximum percentage of replicas per partition allowed to be unhealthy before your application is considered in error.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___serviceTypeHealthPolicyMap.description:
Defines a ServiceTypeHealthPolicy per service type name.

The entries in the map replace the default service type health policy for each specified service type.
For example, in an application that contains both a stateless gateway service type and a stateful engine service type, the health policies for the stateless and stateful services can be configured differently.
With policy per service type, there's more granular control of the health of the service.

If no policy is specified for a service type name, the DefaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy is used for evaluation.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___minimumNodes.description: The minimum number of nodes where Service Fabric will reserve capacity for this application. Note that this does not mean that the services of this application will be placed on all of those nodes. If this property is set to zero, no capacity will be reserved. The value of this property cannot be more than the value of the MaximumNodes property.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___removeApplicationCapacity.description: Remove the current application capacity settings.

___typeName.description: The application type name as defined in the application manifest.

$eref.description: Describes the policy for a monitored application upgrade.

___forceRestart.description: If true, then processes are forcefully restarted during upgrade even when the code version has not changed (the upgrade only changes configuration or data).

___applicationHealthPolicy.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of an application or one of its children entities.

___upgradeReplicaSetCheckTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to block processing of an upgrade domain and prevent loss of availability when there are unexpected issues. When this timeout expires, processing of the upgrade domain will proceed regardless of availability loss issues. The timeout is reset at the start of each upgrade domain. Valid values are between 0 and 42949672925 inclusive. (unsigned 32-bit integer).

___rollingUpgradeMonitoringPolicy.description: The policy used for monitoring the application upgrade

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___upgradePolicy.description: Describes the policy for a monitored application upgrade.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___parameters.description: List of application parameters with overridden values from their default values specified in the application manifest.

___typeVersion.description: The version of the application type as defined in the application manifest.

$eref.description: Describes capacity information for a custom resource balancing metric. This can be used to limit the total consumption of this metric by the services of this application.

___name.description: The name of the metric.

___totalApplicationCapacity.description:
The total metric capacity for Service Fabric application.
This is the total metric capacity for this application in the cluster. Service Fabric will try to limit the sum of loads of services within the application to this value.
When creating a new application with application capacity defined, the product of MaximumNodes and MaximumCapacity must always be smaller than or equal to this value.

___maximumCapacity.description:
The maximum node capacity for Service Fabric application.
This is the maximum Load for an instance of this application on a single node. Even if the capacity of node is greater than this value, Service Fabric will limit the total load of services within the application on each node to this value.
If set to zero, capacity for this metric is unlimited on each node.
When creating a new application with application capacity defined, the product of MaximumNodes and this value must always be smaller than or equal to TotalApplicationCapacity.
When updating existing application with application capacity, the product of MaximumNodes and this value must always be smaller than or equal to TotalApplicationCapacity.

___reservationCapacity.description:
The node reservation capacity for Service Fabric application.
This is the amount of load which is reserved on nodes which have instances of this application.
If MinimumNodes is specified, then the product of these values will be the capacity reserved in the cluster for the application.
If set to zero, no capacity is reserved for this metric.
When setting application capacity or when updating application capacity; this value must be smaller than or equal to MaximumCapacity for each metric.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___metrics.description: List of application capacity metric description.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maximumNodes.description: The maximum number of nodes where Service Fabric will reserve capacity for this application. Note that this does not mean that the services of this application will be placed on all of those nodes. By default, the value of this property is zero and it means that the services can be placed on any node.

_88ApplicationHealthPolicy.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of an application or one of its children entities.

$eref.description: Represents the health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type.

___maxPercentUnhealthyServices.description: The maximum percentage of services allowed to be unhealthy before your application is considered in error.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___defaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy.description: Represents the health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type.

$eref.description: Represents the health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type.

___maxPercentUnhealthyServices.description: The maximum percentage of services allowed to be unhealthy before your application is considered in error.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___serviceTypeHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a ServiceTypeHealthPolicy per service type name.

The entries in the map replace the default service type health policy for each specified service type.
For example, in an application that contains both a stateless gateway service type and a stateful engine service type, the health policies for the stateless and stateful services can be configured differently.
With policy per service type, there's more granular control of the health of the service.

If no policy is specified for a service type name, the DefaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy is used for evaluation.

_88StatelessServiceProperties.description: The properties of a stateless service resource.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

_88ClusterUpgradeDeltaHealthPolicy.description: Describes the delta health policies for the cluster upgrade.

$eref.description: Defines a delta health policy used to evaluate the health of an application or one of its child entities when upgrading the cluster.

___defaultServiceTypeDeltaHealthPolicy.description: Represents the delta health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type when upgrading the cluster.

___serviceTypeDeltaHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a map that contains specific delta health policies for different service types.
Each entry specifies as key the service type name and as value a ServiceTypeDeltaHealthPolicy used to evaluate the service health when upgrading the cluster.
The map is empty by default.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___applicationDeltaHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a map that contains specific application delta health policies for different applications.
Each entry specifies as key the application name and as value an ApplicationDeltaHealthPolicy used to evaluate the application health when upgrading the cluster.
The application name should include the 'fabric:' URI scheme.
The map is empty by default.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maxPercentDeltaUnhealthyNodes.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of nodes health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the nodes at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the nodes at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maxPercentDeltaUnhealthyApplications.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of applications health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the applications at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the applications at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits. System services are not included in this.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maxPercentUpgradeDomainDeltaUnhealthy.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of upgrade domain nodes health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.
The delta is measured between the state of the upgrade domain nodes at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the upgrade domain nodes at the time of the health evaluation.
The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion for all completed upgrade domains to make sure the state of the upgrade domains is within tolerated limits.

_88ApplicationUpgradePolicy.description: Describes the policy for a monitored application upgrade.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___forceRestart.description: If true, then processes are forcefully restarted during upgrade even when the code version has not changed (the upgrade only changes configuration or data).

$eref.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of an application or one of its children entities.

___considerWarningAsError.description: Indicates whether warnings are treated with the same severity as errors.

___defaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy.description: Represents the health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type.

___maxPercentUnhealthyDeployedApplicatio.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy deployed applications. Allowed values are Byte values from zero to 100.
The percentage represents the maximum tolerated percentage of deployed applications that can be unhealthy before the application is considered in error.
This is calculated by dividing the number of unhealthy deployed applications over the number of nodes where the application is currently deployed on in the cluster.
The computation rounds up to tolerate one failure on small numbers of nodes. Default percentage is zero.

___serviceTypeHealthPolicyMap.description:
Defines a ServiceTypeHealthPolicy per service type name.

The entries in the map replace the default service type health policy for each specified service type.
For example, in an application that contains both a stateless gateway service type and a stateful engine service type, the health policies for the stateless and stateful services can be configured differently.
With policy per service type, there's more granular control of the health of the service.

If no policy is specified for a service type name, the DefaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy is used for evaluation.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___applicationHealthPolicy.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of an application or one of its children entities.

___upgradeReplicaSetCheckTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to block processing of an upgrade domain and prevent loss of availability when there are unexpected issues. When this timeout expires, processing of the upgrade domain will proceed regardless of availability loss issues. The timeout is reset at the start of each upgrade domain. Valid values are between 0 and 42949672925 inclusive. (unsigned 32-bit integer).

$eref.description: The policy used for monitoring the application upgrade

___upgradeDomainTimeout.description: The amount of time each upgrade domain has to complete before FailureAction is executed. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___upgradeTimeout.description: The amount of time the overall upgrade has to complete before FailureAction is executed. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___healthCheckStableDuration.description: The amount of time that the application or cluster must remain healthy before the upgrade proceeds to the next upgrade domain. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___healthCheckRetryTimeout.description: The amount of time to retry health evaluation when the application or cluster is unhealthy before FailureAction is executed. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___healthCheckWaitDuration.description: The amount of time to wait after completing an upgrade domain before applying health policies. It is first interpreted as a string representing an ISO 8601 duration. If that fails, then it is interpreted as a number representing the total number of milliseconds.

___failureAction.description: The activation Mode of the service package.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___rollingUpgradeMonitoringPolicy.description: The policy used for monitoring the application upgrade

_88ApplicationMetricDescription.description: Describes capacity information for a custom resource balancing metric. This can be used to limit the total consumption of this metric by the services of this application.

___name.description: The name of the metric.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___totalApplicationCapacity.description:
The total metric capacity for Service Fabric application.
This is the total metric capacity for this application in the cluster. Service Fabric will try to limit the sum of loads of services within the application to this value.
When creating a new application with application capacity defined, the product of MaximumNodes and MaximumCapacity must always be smaller than or equal to this value.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maximumCapacity.description:
The maximum node capacity for Service Fabric application.
This is the maximum Load for an instance of this application on a single node. Even if the capacity of node is greater than this value, Service Fabric will limit the total load of services within the application on each node to this value.
If set to zero, capacity for this metric is unlimited on each node.
When creating a new application with application capacity defined, the product of MaximumNodes and this value must always be smaller than or equal to TotalApplicationCapacity.
When updating existing application with application capacity, the product of MaximumNodes and this value must always be smaller than or equal to TotalApplicationCapacity.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___reservationCapacity.description:
The node reservation capacity for Service Fabric application.
This is the amount of load which is reserved on nodes which have instances of this application.
If MinimumNodes is specified, then the product of these values will be the capacity reserved in the cluster for the application.
If set to zero, no capacity is reserved for this metric.
When setting application capacity or when updating application capacity; this value must be smaller than or equal to MaximumCapacity for each metric.

_88ClusterHealthPolicy.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of the cluster or of a cluster node.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maxPercentUnhealthyNodes.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy nodes before reporting an error. For example, to allow 10% of nodes to be unhealthy, this value would be 10.

The percentage represents the maximum tolerated percentage of nodes that can be unhealthy before the cluster is considered in error.
If the percentage is respected but there is at least one unhealthy node, the health is evaluated as Warning.
The percentage is calculated by dividing the number of unhealthy nodes over the total number of nodes in the cluster.
The computation rounds up to tolerate one failure on small numbers of nodes. Default percentage is zero.

In large clusters, some nodes will always be down or out for repairs, so this percentage should be configured to tolerate that.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maxPercentUnhealthyApplications.description:
The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy applications before reporting an error. For example, to allow 10% of applications to be unhealthy, this value would be 10.

The percentage represents the maximum tolerated percentage of applications that can be unhealthy before the cluster is considered in error.
If the percentage is respected but there is at least one unhealthy application, the health is evaluated as Warning.
This is calculated by dividing the number of unhealthy applications over the total number of application instances in the cluster, excluding applications of application types that are included in the ApplicationTypeHealthPolicyMap.
The computation rounds up to tolerate one failure on small numbers of applications. Default percentage is zero.

$eref.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of an application or one of its children entities.

___defaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy.description: Represents the health policy used to evaluate the health of services belonging to a service type.

___serviceTypeHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a ServiceTypeHealthPolicy per service type name.

The entries in the map replace the default service type health policy for each specified service type.
For example, in an application that contains both a stateless gateway service type and a stateful engine service type, the health policies for the stateless and stateful services can be configured differently.
With policy per service type, there's more granular control of the health of the service.

If no policy is specified for a service type name, the DefaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy is used for evaluation.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___applicationHealthPolicies.description:
Defines a map that contains specific application health policies for different applications.
Each entry specifies as key the application name and as value an ApplicationHealthPolicy used to evaluate the application health.
The application name should include the 'fabric:' URI scheme.
The map is empty by default.

$eref.description: Describes a section in the fabric settings of the cluster.

___name.description: The section name of the fabric settings.

___parameters.description: The collection of parameters in the section.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___fabricSettings.description: The list of custom fabric settings to configure the cluster.

$eref.description: Describes the certificate details.
Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
Describes a list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

___commonNames.description: The list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___certificateCommonNames.description: Describes a list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

$eref.description: Describes the policy used when upgrading the cluster.

___upgradeDomainTimeout.description: The amount of time each upgrade domain has to complete before the upgrade rolls back. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___upgradeTimeout.description: The amount of time the overall upgrade has to complete before the upgrade rolls back. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___forceRestart.description: If true, then processes are forcefully restarted during upgrade even when the code version has not changed (the upgrade only changes configuration or data).

___healthCheckStableDuration.description: The amount of time that the application or cluster must remain healthy before the upgrade proceeds to the next upgrade domain. The duration can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___deltaHealthPolicy.description: Describes the delta health policies for the cluster upgrade.

___healthPolicy.description: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of the cluster or of a cluster node.

___healthCheckRetryTimeout.description: The amount of time to retry health evaluation when the application or cluster is unhealthy before the upgrade rolls back. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___upgradeReplicaSetCheckTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to block processing of an upgrade domain and prevent loss of availability when there are unexpected issues. When this timeout expires, processing of the upgrade domain will proceed regardless of availability loss issues. The timeout is reset at the start of each upgrade domain. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

___healthCheckWaitDuration.description: The length of time to wait after completing an upgrade domain before performing health checks. The duration can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___upgradeDescription.description: Describes the policy used when upgrading the cluster.

___managementEndpoint.description: The http management endpoint of the cluster.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___upgradeMode.description:
The upgrade mode of the cluster when new Service Fabric runtime version is available.

  - Automatic - The cluster will be automatically upgraded to the latest Service Fabric runtime version as soon as it is available.
  - Manual - The cluster will not be automatically upgraded to the latest Service Fabric runtime version. The cluster is upgraded by setting the **clusterCodeVersion** property in the cluster resource.
.

$eref.description: Describes the client certificate details using thumbprint.

___isAdmin.description: Indicates if the client certificate has admin access to the cluster. Non admin clients can perform only read only operations on the cluster.

___certificateThumbprint.description: The thumbprint of the client certificate.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___clientCertificateThumbprints.description: The list of client certificates referenced by thumbprint that are allowed to manage the cluster.

___vmImage.description: The VM image VMSS has been configured with. Generic names such as Windows or Linux can be used.

$eref.description: Describes the certificate details.
Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___clusterCodeVersion.description: The Service Fabric runtime version of the cluster. This property can only by set the user when **upgradeMode** is set to 'Manual'. To get list of available Service Fabric versions for new clusters use [ClusterVersion API](./ClusterVersion.md). To get the list of available version for existing clusters use **availableClusterVersions**.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___addOnFeatures.description: The list of add-on features to enable in the cluster.

$eref.description: The settings to enable AAD authentication on the cluster.

___clusterApplication.description: Azure active directory cluster application id.

___clientApplication.description: Azure active directory client application id.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___azureActiveDirectory.description: The settings to enable AAD authentication on the cluster.

$eref.description: Describes a node type in the cluster, each node type represents sub set of nodes in the cluster.

___name.description: The name of the node type.

___isPrimary.description: The node type on which system services will run. Only one node type should be marked as primary. Primary node type cannot be deleted or changed for existing clusters.

___durabilityLevel.description:
The durability level of the node type. Learn about [DurabilityLevel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-cluster-capacity).

  - Bronze - No privileges. This is the default.
  - Silver - The infrastructure jobs can be paused for a duration of 10 minutes per UD.
  - Gold - The infrastructure jobs can be paused for a duration of 2 hours per UD. Gold durability can be enabled only on full node VM skus like D15_V2, G5 etc.
.

___httpGatewayEndpointPort.description: The HTTP cluster management endpoint port.

___reverseProxyEndpointPort.description: The endpoint used by reverse proxy.

___capacities.description: The capacity tags applied to the nodes in the node type, the cluster resource manager uses these tags to understand how much resource a node has.

___placementProperties.description: The placement tags applied to nodes in the node type, which can be used to indicate where certain services (workload) should run.

___clientConnectionEndpointPort.description: The TCP cluster management endpoint port.

___vmInstanceCount.description: The number of nodes in the node type. This count should match the capacity property in the corresponding VirtualMachineScaleSet resource.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___nodeTypes.description: The list of node types in the cluster.

$eref.description: Describes the client certificate details using common name.

___certificateCommonName.description: The common name of the client certificate.

___isAdmin.description: Indicates if the client certificate has admin access to the cluster. Non admin clients can perform only read only operations on the cluster.

___certificateIssuerThumbprint.description: The issuer thumbprint of the client certificate.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___clientCertificateCommonNames.description: The list of client certificates referenced by common name that are allowed to manage the cluster.

$eref.description: Describes a list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

___commonNames.description: The list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___reverseProxyCertificateCommonNames.description: Describes a list of server certificates referenced by common name that are used to secure the cluster.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___reliabilityLevel.description:
The reliability level sets the replica set size of system services. Learn about [ReliabilityLevel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-cluster-capacity).

  - None - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 1. This should only be used for test clusters.
  - Bronze - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 3. This should only be used for test clusters.
  - Silver - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 5.
  - Gold - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 7.
  - Platinum - Run the System services with a target replica set count of 9.
.

$eref.description: The storage account information for storing Service Fabric diagnostic logs.

___protectedAccountKeyName.description: The protected diagnostics storage key name.

___blobEndpoint.description: The blob endpoint of the azure storage account.
